comments.body: When using `--single-version-externally-manage` there is a change you don't need to list the run dependencies (everything below) at build time. (But if the package imports itself  you may need those.)

It imports itself in the following places:

./aospy/test/test_utils_io.py:6:import aospy.utils.io as io
./aospy/test/test_utils_vertcoord.py:8:import aospy.utils.vertcoord as vertcoord
./examples/main.py:53:import aospy
But not in `setup.py` so you can probably remove everything but `python` and `setuptools` from the `build` section.

However, leave `pytest-runner` because it is explicitly listed in `setup.py`. (But I don't think that is needed. Maybe that you can fix the code upstream. I guess that the devs meant it to be `tests_require` instead of `setup_requires`, no? Not really sure as I never used it.)

Ok, I've removed all but python, setuptools, and pytest-runner.

The inclusion of pytest-runner was to follow the pytest guidelines listed here: http://doc.pytest.org/en/latest/goodpractices.html#integrating-with-setuptools-python-setup-py-test-pytest-runner

But I don't think that functionality is important enough to add this dependency; I'll likely remove it in the next release.
I guess that I always used the manual integration. There is no harm in leaving that there BTW.
